intro: Strobilanthes microcephala, commonly known as the "Little Head" or "Tiny Head" plant, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its small, delicate flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, often in forest understories. Its foliage is usually lance-shaped with a smooth texture, and it has a short flowering period. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
